snippet: As a rapidly graying population sparks worries about a pension bust, an important figure in the property business pushes a controversial solution....
abstract: Meng Xiaosu, businessman who laid groundwork for private homeownership in China, is urging elderly to take out reverse home mortgages as way to solve country's looming pension crisis; government think tank says by 2050 elderly will comprise nearly one-quarter of China's population and country's pension fund will be $116 trillion in red; reverse mortgage proposal has not been well received because it defies traditions.

byline.contributor: Zhang Tiantian in Beijing contributed research.

lead_paragraph: As a rapidly graying population sparks worries about a pension bust, an important figure in the property business pushes a controversial solution.

headline.main: China’s ‘Godfather of Real Estate’ Pitches Reverse Mortgages to Skeptical Elders
